Hey LuxLOL, nice work, I love it, runs beautifully! Just a couple quick questions: 1) any way I can get the sleep and hibernate functions; and, 2) any way I can install Outlook Express? (the second questions may seem silly, but I still prefer it over all other email clients)
Cheers

If you have no hibernate function then you need to install the mainboard driver, if you have a intel mainboard you find the driver here:
http://downloadcenter.intel.com
Intel速 Chipset Device Software (INF Update Utility)

And the free Outlook Express has been replaced by Microsoft by the free Windows Live Mail and the not free Microsoft Outlook 2010

Hi. I'm a total newbie at this, and I didn't get how to remove the drivers. Is it absolutely necessary? Or I can skip it? Thank you.

Remove the drivers O_o? What do you want to do?

If you need help with reinstalling a Windows XP then open the read me file and read the section ->
(o) Infos on how to install Windows XP new:
It's in the 'Help Guides'  o_o '(o) Infos on how to Remove the included Drivers and include you own Drivers'

Yes you need to do this if the included SATA driver wont work on your computer.

It is not hard simply do what is written in the Guide that's it.
No problems at all, works much better on my Dell Latitude D830 then windows 7!
Can I Install this to a 64-bit computer? Is it possible?
Yes a 32-bit operating system can be installed on a 64-bit computer.
